Text: It appears the stadium isn't all that far from here.

I could simply wait for him there...but a little
detour doesn't sound all that bad, either.

And with that, Aurora sprang lightly into the air,
sending herself in another direction not leading to
the stadium.

(Once we escape from here, this world will disappear.
And of course it would, since this all only exists in
memories...)

Hehe, what's gotten into me, wanting to take in the
sights of a world that's fated to vanish?
...This seems like the highest spot in the area.

From up here, I can see all the streets of this
city... Lindwurm, was it?
So this is the world 1,000 years later...
It...certainly has changed much from the one I knew.

The city wasn’t this large back then. I suppose they
must have cleared away the forest around it.
But...
Violet's eyes narrowed as she reminisced.
there are still some parts that I remember.
Like those steep mountains! They're exactly the same!

I think I remember crying because of how those peaks
look like monsters looming over the city once the sun
sets.

And that praying statue on the outskirts... I wonder
how many times it's been repaired, if it's still a
soothing presence for the people here.

Though much of the forest is gone, I can see that the
springs are still being well cared for.

I once cleansed myself in them as well... Their
waters were so cold in the winter...but it was a
precious moment for me all the same.

Sights similar yet slightly different than the ones
she beheld now swam up in Violet's mind.

(These feelings of familiarity are so sweet...but
they also bring a prickling pain like thorns... My
thoughts toward the past are complicated, I suppose.)
All of this...is from a thousand years later.

This is not the world in which I lived...so why do I
feel such nostalgia, such love for it?
I believe I'll go back down and take a closer look...

Hehe, and maybe I'll get into a little mischief while
I'm at it.
After all, I am "the Calamity Witch".

The moment she spoke the words, she felt a sharp pain
in her chest.
No... It's not like that name means anything.

That's just something all the people from the future,
those illusions, got into their heads...
Ohhh...! I knew I should've brought him with me.

It's because I'm alone that I'm waxing sentimental
like this.
Yes. This is all your fault...

It's because I'm with you that it's hard to forget
everything, that I'm beginning to regret that I must
fade to nothing...

Hehe, speaking of, I wonder if he's managed
to escape.

When she glanced down, Aurora saw a black-clad figure
pop out of a dark pile of people and race through the
streets at incredible speed. She could guess what it
was without even thinking about it.

Hehehe, he really is something. Shaking off a mob
like that is no easy feat.

At that pace, it won't take him much time at all to
reach the stadium.

...Which means, I need to say my farewells to this
view.

It's time to go...Aurora. Time to go where you
belong...
The arena, around the same time...
Phew... I finally got away from 'em.
Now I just need to take myself out...
Oh, there I am.

My name is Shadow. Grant me an ancient memory that
rests in the Sanctuary...!
(Nice. Gotta say, I don't look too shabby.)
(I wonder if this is how everyone else saw me.)

(Yep, that was a pretty good entrance, if I do say so
myself.)
Now then, what to do.

(Me and him are gonna fight exactly the same, of
course. Basically watch the other guy and then
adapt to that.)
(So in that case, hmm...)

(...A stalemate. That's probably how it'll end. We'll
spend the whole time trying to suss out each other's
first move.)

That means there's no time for slowly working my
magic up. Nope, I gotta finish this in one go.
Bye-bye, me.

The two Shadows squared off. No sooner had one of
them shoved a mop handle through the other's chest
than a sound like glass shattering rang out.
You startled me...!
Hm...? Oh, hey, Violet. What took ya so long?

I took my time since, well, I thought it would take
you a bit longer to defeat yourself.

But...it seems that wasn't the case. You are you,
after all.
But...

Huh, what is it? Stop looking at me all disappointed
like that.
It's just...couldn't you have used a proper weapon?

A stylish finish pulled off with the handle of a mop
doesn't have quite the same impact.

Hey, I was up against regular citizens, okay? It's
crazier to think I'd even be able to get ahold of a
real weapon. I was lucky to find even this mop.

I'm sure the other me never thought he'd meet his
death at the end of a mop, though.
Welp...there goes the world.
...Indeed. All will be dark again.
And now we get back to our core hunt.
Yes...
Something the matter, Violet?
No, it's nothing.

I just...I just felt the tiniest bit sad to say
goodbye to this world.

That little girl bumped into me while we were walking
through the city, we gave the cold shoulder to that
street stall, and then, oh yes...had a lovely meal.
And then we ran out on the bill for said meal.
That was all you...!
Hehe, but that, too, is another precious memory.

Now this future where we made so many memories
together in such a short time is going away... I
can't help but feel sad about it...
Say, how does it feel to you?

Hmm... Well, I suppose I would've liked for my fight
against myself to last a little longer. Oh yeah, and
the finish was kinda weak and lacked creativity.
But I didn't have to build up my magic slowly, so...
You didn't listen to a thing I said...!
Huh? You said something?
Hehe, it's fine. I was speaking to myself, anyway.

Now, let's be on our way. This world is going to
close completely.
Yeah. Off to the center of the Sanctuary we go!
